intro: Gossia pancheri, commonly known as the Pancheri gossia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often with a fragrant scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
